averycowan.event

Class EventListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • averycowan.event.EventListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener

    public abstract class EventListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.EventListener
    Extend this class when making an event listener. Register an EventListener with EventManager.addListener(EventListener listener);. This can be a standard class or an anonymous inner class as long as onEvent() and getEventType() are implemented.
    Author:
    Avery Cowan
    See Also:
    EventManager

      boolean eventTriggered(Event e)
      Runtime magic.
      abstract java.lang.Class<?> getEventType()
      This tells the EventManager what type of event the EventListener is listening for.

    • Method Detail

      • getEventType

        public abstract java.lang.Class<?> getEventType()
        This tells the EventManager what type of event the EventListener is listening for.
        Returns:
        a Class object representing the Event this represents.

      • eventTriggered

        public final boolean eventTriggered(Event e)
        Runtime magic. Do not touch.
        Parameters:
        e - the event to pass.
        Returns:
        whether the Event was passed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if e is not the right type.
